newsitem.title: USA: Cyrix says "on track" for 97 profit.
newsitem.headline: Cyrix says "on track" for 97 profit.

text.p: Cyrix Corp said Wednesday it is on track to make a profit for the year, despite reporting a second-quarter loss of $5.3 million, or $0.27 a share.

"Despite the loss in the second quarter, Cyrix remains on track to achieve significant revenue growth and return to solid profitability in 1997," said acting chief executive Jay Swent. "Our current product lineup is the strongest in the company's history."

"We are well positioned to take advantage of the growth opportunities in both the sub-$1000 PC market with the MediaGX nd the mid-range PC marketplace with the newly launched, MMX enhanced 6x68MX processor," he said.

Despite the second-quarter loss, the manufacturer of computer processors posted a profit of $1.3 million, or $0.07 a share, in the first half, compared with a loss of $14.4 million, or $0.75 a share, the year before. Cyrix's revenues rose 47 percent to $115.6 million in the same period from $78.7 million posted last year.
Cyrix stock closed at 23 Wednesday, up 1-7/16.
